judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.

opinions.text:
Pee Cubiam,
The order of the court below, dismissing appeal from and affirming the order of the department of revenue refusing appellant’s petition for reassessment of tax under the Emergency Belief Sales Tax Act of August 19,1932, P. L. 92, is affirmed on the opinion written for the court by Judge Steen.
opinions.author: Pee Cubiam,

attorneys: Jacob Bomm, with him Marcus D. Butkin, for appellant.
Leo Weinrott, Special Deputy Attorney General, and ~Wm. A. Schnader, Attorney General, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Biser’s Appeal.
Argued December 6, 1934.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
January 7, 1935:
Jacob Bomm, with him Marcus D. Butkin, for appellant.
Leo Weinrott, Special Deputy Attorney General, and ~Wm. A. Schnader, Attorney General, for appellee, were not heard.
